meanings.definition: To take the place of (a person or thing previously in authority or use)
meanings.sent1: A new king supercedes the old ruler.
meanings.sent3: The young prince supercedes the old king in a friendly chess match.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun supercedes the darkness of night.
meanings.sent5: The fresh coat of paint supercedes the old, peeling layer, brightening the room.

meanings.definition: To replace (something older or less effective)
meanings.sent1: A modern machine supercedes the manual labor of the past.
meanings.sent2: New information supercedes the need for old textbooks.
meanings.sent3: The new recipe supercedes the old one, making dinner more delicious.
meanings.sent4: The young athlete supercedes the veteran player in skill and speed.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant flowers supercedes the dull, wilted ones, bringing color to the garden.
